newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged on select buying.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged on select buying.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates were unchanged on Wednesday amid select buying by mill owners and dealers said prices would remain stable in the near term on demand from exporters.

"Trading activity has picked up today. There is select buying from mill owners as yarn prices are stable in the local market," dealer Nasim Usman said. "Exporters are also showing interest in low quality stocks."
In the kerb market, NIAB-78 was traded between 1,850 ($45.86) to 2,100 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) and K-68 between 2,150 to 2,200, he said.
